MissionCommands.Message: Welcome to the Mission Control Live version of the Mercury-Redstone 3 historical mission. The cockpit is ready for full internal power and final checks.

Title: MR-3: Freedom 7 (MCC)
Description:
The Mercury-Redstone 3 (Freedom 7) mission is the first U.S. space flight with the goals of testing attitude control modes, mans ability to operate in space and verify spacecraft systems.

Astronaut: Alan Shepard
BriefingText:
Mercury-Redstone 3: "Freedom 7"

Mission Objectives:
1. Familiarize man with a brief but complete space flight experience, including the lift-off, powered flight, weightless flight (approximately 5 minutes), re-entry, and landing phases of the flight.
2. Evaluate man's ability to perform as a functional unit during space flight by demonstrating manual control of spacecraft attitude before, during, and after retrofire and by use of voice communications during flight.
3. Study man's physiological reactions during space flight.
4. Recover the astronaut and spacecraft.

Flight Plan:
00:00 - Lift-off
01:24 - Pressure checks, max-q
02:22 - Launch Vehicle cutoff & tower sep
02:32 - Spacecraft sep and periscope deploy
02:37 - Turnaround
03:10 - Manual Control tests with ASCS
 Take manual control one axis at a time:
 A) Manual pitch, -14.5 to -34, then back to -14.5
 B) Manual yaw, left to -10, then back to 0
 C) Manual roll, left to -10, then back to 0

03:50 - Periscope visual observation in orbit attitude (-14 pitch, 0 yaw, 0 roll)
04:44 - Initiate retrofire sequence, return to retro fire attitude (-34 pitch, 0 yaw, 0 roll)
05:14 - Retrofire under manual control in all axes
06:14 - Retro jettison
06:15 - HF checks
06:20 - Reentry attitude using FBW (+34 pitch, 0 yaw, 0 roll)
06:44 - Periscope retroact (will happen with 0.05g in Reentry)
07:48 - Periscope retroact, 0.05g
08:20 - Max reentry accel.
09:38 - Drogue scope deploy
10:15 - Main chute deploy
15:22 - Landing (slightly offset in Reentry, tuning still)


Mission details:
Commander: Alan Shepard
Capsule name: Freedom-7
Booster: Redstone
Mission Profile: Sub-orbital

Planned launch time: May 5th 1961 07:20 AM EST
Countdown Start: May 4th 1961 ~8:30 PM EST
Capsule Ingress: May 5th 1961 05:15AM EST (06:15 EDT)
Unplanned delay at 07:05 EST for 1hr to let cloud cover clear and to fix a faulty power supply 
Shortly after countdown resume, further delays were caused by a system reboot at the Goddard Spaceflight center.

Mission start: 
T -15 minutes with final checks

Notes:
Reentry has desgined a generic capsule with all of the main Mercury features. Some readouts such as voltages, amps, trajectory details etc, might differ from audio. I have tried to recreate the mission to the best of my abilities within the limitation of my sim.

Have a good flight!
